snippet.textDisplay: "Gameplay", the only PS4 exclusive I played that had amazing and replayable gameplay was BloodBorne, the rest of PS4's games are pretty much movies with no replayability. I got a PS4 for BloodBorne and I wanted to see what all the buzz was about, but all its exclusives are so lame. What happened to the actually good PlayStation games like Killzone, Warhawk, StarHawk, and Resistance? Last of Us was a good movie, but I don't want to watch the same movie for hundreds of hours. Uncharted does nothing special, freaking gosh of war 4 is a poor mans version and a bastardization of the original games, the JRPGs no one talks about are better than the so called "heavy hitters". Spiderman, boy who plays games based off of movies? Just Cause is way more fun with the grappling hook. I played some Horizion Zero dawn and after Aloy's dad died and you are searching for whatever, I have to force myself to get back in the game. Dark Souls provides a better story and better gameplay than any PlayStation exclusive I know. Ghost of Tsushima looks like a movie with shallow gameplay, Sekiro looks like what Ghost of Tsushima wishes it was. There aren't even exclusive FPS games on PlayStation. Everyone who swoons about PlayStation exclusives has never played REAL games with actual gameplay. Detroit is a poor man's Tell Tale game. I bought into the lie that PlayStation 4 has so much to offer and so many games to play, but that was a flat out lie. All the exclusives, except BloodBorne, are games you play once and forget about. Ironically Xbox One has a better focus on games even though it was built as a glorified streaming platform. Thousands of people are still playing Xbox exclusives like Halo and Gears of War that came out 10, 15, and 20 years ago. That many people definitely won't be playing PS4 exclusives 20 years from now. It doesn't matter how many exclusives there are to offer if all of them offer 10 minutes of generic gameplay. Please give me an example of a PlayStation exclusive that has better gameplay than Halo, Gears of War, or Dark Souls.
snippet.textOriginal: "Gameplay", the only PS4 exclusive I played that had amazing and replayable gameplay was BloodBorne, the rest of PS4's games are pretty much movies with no replayability. I got a PS4 for BloodBorne and I wanted to see what all the buzz was about, but all its exclusives are so lame. What happened to the actually good PlayStation games like Killzone, Warhawk, StarHawk, and Resistance? Last of Us was a good movie, but I don't want to watch the same movie for hundreds of hours. Uncharted does nothing special, freaking gosh of war 4 is a poor mans version and a bastardization of the original games, the JRPGs no one talks about are better than the so called "heavy hitters". Spiderman, boy who plays games based off of movies? Just Cause is way more fun with the grappling hook. I played some Horizion Zero dawn and after Aloy's dad died and you are searching for whatever, I have to force myself to get back in the game. Dark Souls provides a better story and better gameplay than any PlayStation exclusive I know. Ghost of Tsushima looks like a movie with shallow gameplay, Sekiro looks like what Ghost of Tsushima wishes it was. There aren't even exclusive FPS games on PlayStation. Everyone who swoons about PlayStation exclusives has never played REAL games with actual gameplay. Detroit is a poor man's Tell Tale game. I bought into the lie that PlayStation 4 has so much to offer and so many games to play, but that was a flat out lie. All the exclusives, except BloodBorne, are games you play once and forget about. Ironically Xbox One has a better focus on games even though it was built as a glorified streaming platform. Thousands of people are still playing Xbox exclusives like Halo and Gears of War that came out 10, 15, and 20 years ago. That many people definitely won't be playing PS4 exclusives 20 years from now. It doesn't matter how many exclusives there are to offer if all of them offer 10 minutes of generic gameplay. Please give me an example of a PlayStation exclusive that has better gameplay than Halo, Gears of War, or Dark Souls.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am... extremely underwhelmed...
Let's take away the PR speak and the fancy pictures:
Haptic feedback
The share button has been re branded to a create button
Microphone(s?)
New USB connector

It comes in black and white
Like every designer, we have done a lot of concepting and mockups
Tested to feel comfortable in everyone's hands


Back button attachment still sold separately?
And with the new usb, you may end up buying that twice.
snippet.textOriginal:
I am... extremely underwhelmed...
Let's take away the PR speak and the fancy pictures:
Haptic feedback
The share button has been re branded to a create button
Microphone(s?)
New USB connector

It comes in black and white
Like every designer, we have done a lot of concepting and mockups
Tested to feel comfortable in everyone's hands


Back button attachment still sold separately?
And with the new usb, you may end up buying that twice.

snippet.textDisplay: You know what I've never needed in video games? Haptic feedback. I've never needed my controller to vibrate, shake or otherwise when I fire a gun, drive a car, punch a kitten, shave a donkey, etc. What I do need, however, is the game to control well and the controller itself to feel good and ergonomic in my hands.
snippet.textOriginal: You know what I've never needed in video games? Haptic feedback. I've never needed my controller to vibrate, shake or otherwise when I fire a gun, drive a car, punch a kitten, shave a donkey, etc. What I do need, however, is the game to control well and the controller itself to feel good and ergonomic in my hands.

snippet.textDisplay: Sony's problem was getting the controller right the first time. The controller is a type of PR for any new system  and the shape of the ps controller hasn't really changed much. sure they have added dual sticks, "rumble", analog buttons, touch pad, better bumper and triggers, subtracted wires and added headphone jacks but still in pretty much the same shape. PR is the reason we got the boomerang I just hope its not the reason for this one.
snippet.textOriginal: Sony's problem was getting the controller right the first time. The controller is a type of PR for any new system  and the shape of the ps controller hasn't really changed much. sure they have added dual sticks, "rumble", analog buttons, touch pad, better bumper and triggers, subtracted wires and added headphone jacks but still in pretty much the same shape. PR is the reason we got the boomerang I just hope its not the reason for this one.

snippet.textDisplay:
Am I the only one who'd rather just have the PS2 controller design? L2/R2 being buttons instead of triggers too.

Ever since I was forced to replace my dying 10 year old PS2 controller (with the PS4), it's been a wholly negative experience.. ontop of the DS4's much worse build quality, notably the analog sticks (which can be fault from the factory with jitter).


I just want the PS2 controller design back, in an official capacity and not third party crap with varying implementations.


..and PC games supporting it too, not giving us xbox-only prompts. C'mon devs.
snippet.textOriginal:
Am I the only one who'd rather just have the PS2 controller design?   L2/R2 being buttons instead of triggers too.

Ever since I was forced to replace my dying 10 year old PS2 controller (with the PS4), it's been a wholly negative experience.. ontop of the DS4's much worse build quality, notably the analog sticks (which can be fault from the factory with jitter).


I just want the PS2 controller design back, in an official capacity and not third party crap with varying implementations.


..and PC games supporting it too, not giving us xbox-only prompts.   C'mon devs.

snippet.textDisplay: Not complaining but it seems like they're selling pizzazz here. So they added vibration to the triggers (which Nintendo switch and Xbox already have) and painted it 2 colors to give it that "wow this is really new and futuristic!" Feel. The other actual new feature is a built in mic for some quick chats if needed which is a decent add on. Still don't want to give players the option to use batteries or rechargeable packs which seems stubborn and backwards thinking just so they're different from xbox
snippet.textOriginal: Not complaining but it seems like they're selling pizzazz here. So they added vibration to the triggers (which Nintendo switch and Xbox already have) and painted it 2 colors to give it that "wow this is really new and futuristic!" Feel. The other actual new feature is a built in mic for some quick chats if needed which is a decent add on. Still don't want to give players the option to use batteries or rechargeable packs which seems stubborn and backwards thinking just so they're different from xbox

snippet.textDisplay: I’m disappointed Sony (and Microsoft) chose to not include paddles in the standard controllers. I don’t expect haptic feedback to get much use. Most games will still come out on multiple platforms, and like PS5’s higher speed storage, haptic feedback will not be utilized in all games since other platforms don’t utilize it.
snippet.textOriginal: I’m disappointed Sony (and Microsoft) chose to not include paddles in the standard controllers. I don’t expect haptic feedback to get much use. Most games will still come out on multiple platforms, and like PS5’s higher speed storage, haptic feedback will not be utilized in all games since other platforms don’t utilize it.
